item.title: Beogram 4002: A New Day, a New Hood!
item.description:
I recently got a new dust cover for a Beogram turntable from Beoparts-shop in Denmark. These covers are made using the same injection molding process as the originals, so they have a seamless look, unlike older reproduction covers that were made by fusing together laser-cut pieces. The result is a cover that’s indistinguishable from the original. This photo shows the new cover: The hinge for the cover was missing the small plastic pieces that prevent the spring mechanism from rubbing against the hinge’s metal parts...

item.title: Beogram 4000: Installation of a Brand New Hood!
item.description:
During a recent Beogram 4000 restoration, my customer opted for a brand new reproduction hood from Beoparts-shop in Denmark. These hoods mark a significant advancement in Beogram 400x restoration. Crafted through injection molding, they perfectly mirror the original hoods, eliminating the seams found in laser-cut and fused alternatives. Simply put, these hoods are identical in appearance to the originals. Developed by Beoworld’s Dillen, their availability has greatly benefited Beogram 400x restorations...

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5503): Installation of Upgrades - Internal RIAA Preamp, Commander Remote Control and a New Hood
item.description:
Following the functional restoration of a Beogram 4002 (Type 5503) from Oklahoma, the next step was to add the customer’s desired upgrades. These included an internal Beolover RIAA pre-amplifier (designed for AC motor Beogram 4002s), a Beolover Commander remote control system, and a new hood for a pristine appearance. The first upgrade was preparing the keypad for the Commander remote system. AC motor Beograms primarily use directly soldered wiring harnesses, so Commander installation isn’t “plug and play” like the DC motor version...
